main.name: Patick Duquette
main.description: I am a Junior web developer with many years of technical troubleshooting and customer service experience; passionate about building tools that use technology to solve daily problems
main.bio: I am enrolled in the UT Coding Bootcamp and will be looking for employment in the Austin area after graduation. I would like to start in web developmemnt and eventually explore machine learning and data science. My current programming goals are to get more comfortable with Javascript, learn more about MySQL and Tableau, and to gain some basic understanding of Python. I am fascinated by the technologies that make our modern world work
main.contactmessage: Send me an email. Let's get in touch.

resume.skillmessage: Exposure to MySQL, Python, Tableau, Javascript, Node.js, HTML, CSS, jQuery, Responsive design, Bootstrap, React.js, MySql, MongoDB, Heroku.

education.description: Master of Business Administration - Finance Emphasis

work.title: Senior Support Advisor
work.description: Supported Apple Customers and internal team members and managers through numerous manager backfills, mentoring, coaching, and special projects.

work.title: Realtor and Property Manager
work.description: I worked as a Realtor in Iowa and started a property managenet company to suppliment Real Estate income. I implemented a unique customer tracking system, which increased closed sales by 300%.

projects.title: Password Generator
projects.category: This application generates a random password based on user-selected criteria. This app runs in the browser and features dynamically updated HTML and CSS powered by JavaScript code.

projects.title: Day Planner
projects.category: This app uses the Moment.JS API for date functions and the browser's local storage for storing the input values, as well as JQuery for JavaScript functionality and Bootstrap for styling.

projects.title: Developer pdf Generator
projects.category: A command line application that dynamically generates a PDF profile from a GitHub username. Relies on npmjs packages and Node.js in the command line.

projects.title: Employee Summary
projects.category: A command line application that dynamically generates an HTML page from user inputs. Implements jest for test driven development and relies on node.js.

projects.title: Express Note Taker
projects.category: An HTML application that can be used to write, save, and delete notes. This application uses an express backend and will save and retrieve note data from a JSON file.

projects.title: Employee Tracker
projects.category: This is a command line application that runs with node.js and uses a MySQL database. It is a rudimentary employee database that allows for basic CRUD functionality.

projects.title: Movie Review Database
projects.category: GROUP PROJECT: A deployed website that uses Heroku, MySQL, Travis, and ejs. Allows users to search/create reviews. Pulls movie data from the OMDB API.

projects.title: Recipe Generator
projects.category: GROUP PROJECT: A Website that makes two API calls and generates a date night menu. Users can search or use the interactive navbar to build the menu. Selections persist and can be modified.
